```{r permutation test}
#DON'T NEED TO RUN THIS CHUNK, antoinette will do this part
permutation.test<-function(n1,n2,perms){
  out<-numeric(length = perms)
  for (i in 1:perms){
    sample1<-sample(n1,21715)
    sample2<-sample(n2,21715)
    out[i]<-count(sample1,sample2)
  }
  return(out)
}
og<-count(test.y$Dental.calculus..yellow.build.up.on.teeth,test.y$Extracted.teeth)
test1<-permutation.test(test.y$Dental.calculus..yellow.build.up.on.teeth,test.y$Extracted.teeth,2000)
hist(test1, main= "Permutation Distribution", xlab="", xlim = c(550,1800))
abline(v=og, lwd=3, col="red")

#this distribution makes sense as there is a connection for both bonf and bh
```
